Tucson was now starting to put things together.  Little by little pieces of=
 the mystery were coming to fruition.  Perhaps Cyclonus, Optimus Primal and=
 even Cheetor might have suffered the same fate.  In any event he knew he h=
ad to focus on getting everyone out instead of fighting.  He looks back at =
the guards then back to Big Convoy, implementing an ancient form of sign la=
nguage that only Autobot kind could communicate with.

" If you can help me=
, I can help you and everyone else to escape.  It will take some time and c=
areful tactics but with your knowledge of Magmatron, and the layout of this=
 parameter, and both of our skills combined, I know we can escape this pris=
on.  Now, I need to know if Cyclonus, Optimus Primal, or Cheetor have also =
been taken here.  From here on out, if we communicate this way, they will n=
ot understand us.  Anything related to our escape plan will be communicated=
 this way.  Other than that, we play along as they want and later, we gathe=
r our plans and execute them.  I know this is a little impromptu for you bu=
t, this pit is no place for an established Convoy or Prime."

He looks to B=
ig with an eye of respect and a confident air of intelligence.




Perpetua=
lly on the move and constantly busy. 

On Sep 28, 2011, at 12:34 PM, Super =
Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson felt th=
at somehow he could trust Big Convoy. With sincerity he looks
> > to him. A=
 look often expressed by someone of wisdom and someone who was
> > willing =
to help when others would just turn their back.
> >
> > " I was appointed a=
 Prime unexpectedly. A while ago, I had just learned of
> > Rodimus being a=
bducted by Predacon forces, as I too have just recently
> > returned to the=
 Ark. I went to visit our fallen leader, Optimus Prime, and
> > asked Primu=
s for his help to recover Rodimus. And before I knew it, I was
> > upgraded=
 to a Prime. Before that, I attempted to rescue Rodimus myself. No
> > matt=
er the risk, I knew I had to put his safety ahead of my own. I would do
> >=
 it again and I will. My purpose is to protect the innocent, even if it is
=
> > of great risk to my own life. Tell me, what brings you to a place like
=
> > this? You seem to be more understanding than the usual lot."
> >
> > He=
 walks with Big Convoy, as if walking beside Lord Elder.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> If=
 BIG CONVOY were human he would probrably look like Arnold
> Schwarzenegger=
 as he did in 'Predator' or perhaps 'Conan' with perhaps
> a little of a 'C=
aptain America' kind of a feel. He was tall, massive
> and he had a confide=
nt air about him, almost a swagger. He felt like a
> grizzled old soldier, =
and yet still strong enough to handle anything
> that was thrown at him.
> =

> He grunted, "I am sure you stand for truth, justice and the
> Cybertroni=
an way?" There was a bit of dark humor in his words as he
> walked with TUS=
CON. "I am here because I was captured and brought
> here, just as you have=
 been brought here."
> 
> BIG had brought TUSCON into a large holding area =
where many different
> transformers were being held. At least four or five =
other figures were
> lounging about. Some looked up at BIG and nodded while=
 others just sat
> in the corner looking sullen.
> 
> In the center stood S=
COURGE, or perhaps one of his sweeps, it was hard
> to tell with them, and =
he was practicing with a bladed weapon against
> a pole in the center of th=
e room.
> 
> BIG smiled a dark sardonic smile, "Welcome to the pens." he sa=
id
> humorlessly. "Here is where we learn to survive."
> 
> Pointing out be=
yond a thick set of bars out into a larger area that
> could only just be b=
arely made out beyond them, "And out there is
> where we fight for the plea=
sure of those that hold us."
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson was now starting to put things =
together.  Little by little pieces of the mystery were coming to fruit=
ion.  Perhaps Cyclonus, Optimus Primal and even Cheetor might have suf=
fered the same fate.  In any event he knew he had to focus on getting =
everyone out instead of fighting.  He looks back at the guards then ba=
ck to Big Convoy, implementing an ancient form of sign language that only A=
utobot kind could communicate with.</div><div><br></div><div>" If you can h=
elp me, I can help you and everyone else to escape.  It will take some=
 time and careful tactics but with your knowledge of Magmatron, and the lay=
out of this parameter, and both of our skills combined, I know we can escap=
e this prison.  Now, I need to know if Cyclonus, Optimus Primal, or Ch=
eetor have also been taken here.  From here on out, if we communicate =
this way, they will not understand us.  Anything related to our escape=
 plan will be communicated this way.  Other than that, we play along a=
s they want and later, we gather our plans and execute them.  I know t=
his is a little impromptu for you but, this pit is no place for an establis=
hed Convoy or Prime."</div><div><br></div><div>He looks to Big with an eye =
of respect and a confident air of intelligence.</div><div><br></div><div><b=
r></div><div><br></div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy=
. </div><div><br>On Sep 28, 2011, at 12:34 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a h=
ref=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrot=
e:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Tucson felt that somehow he co=
uld trust Big Convoy.  With sincerity he looks<br>
> to him.  A look oft=
en expressed by someone of wisdom and someone who was<br>
> willing to h=
elp when others would just turn their back.<br>
><br>
> " I was appoi=
nted a Prime unexpectedly.  A while ago, I had just learned of<br>
> Rod=
imus being abducted by Predacon forces, as I too have just recently<br>
&gt=
; returned to the Ark.  I went to visit our fallen leader, Optimus Prime, a=
nd<br>
> asked Primus for his help to recover Rodimus.  And before I kne=
w it, I was<br>
> upgraded to a Prime.  Before that, I attempted to resc=
ue Rodimus myself. No<br>
> matter the risk, I knew I had to put his saf=
ety ahead of my own.  I would do<br>
> it again and I will.  My purpose =
is to protect the innocent, even if it is<br>
> of great risk to my own =
life.  Tell me, what brings you to a place like<br>
> this?  You seem to=
 be more understanding than the usual lot."<br>
><br>
> He walks with=
 Big Convoy, as if walking beside Lord Elder.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>=

If BIG CONVOY were human he would probrably look like Arnold<br>
Schwarzen=
egger as he did in 'Predator' or perhaps 'Conan' with perhaps<br>
a little =
of a 'Captain America' kind of a feel. He was tall, massive<br>
and he had =
a confident air about him, almost a swagger. He felt like a<br>
grizzled ol=
d soldier, and yet still strong enough to handle anything<br>
that was thro=
wn at him.<br>
<br>
He grunted, "I am sure you stand for truth, justice and=
 the<br>
Cybertronian way?" There was a bit of dark humor in his words as h=
e<br>
walked with TUSCON. "I am here because I was captured and brought<br>=

here, just as you have been brought here."<br>
<br>
BIG had brought TUSCON=
 into a large holding area where many different<br>
transformers were being=
 held. At least four or five other figures were<br>
lounging about. Some lo=
oked up at BIG and nodded while others just sat<br>
in the corner looking s=
ullen.<br>
<br>
In the center stood SCOURGE, or perhaps one of his sweeps, =
it was hard<br>
to tell with them, and he was practicing with a bladed weap=
on against<br>
a pole in the center of the room.<br>
<br>
BIG smiled a dark=
 sardonic smile, "Welcome to the pens." he said<br>
humorlessly. "Here is w=
here we learn to survive."<br>
<br>
Pointing out beyond a thick set of bars=
 out into a larger area that<br>
could only just be barely made out beyond =
them, "And out there is<br>
where we fight for the pleasure of those that h=
old us."<br>

Preston<br>
